interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Hawaii Five-0: Season 2
Review Date: 2012/01/25
Store: Alex O'Loughlin  (Actor),     Scott Caan  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["HAWAII FIVE-0 is a contemporary take on the classic series about a new elite federalized task force whose mission is to wipe out the crime that washes up on the Islands' sun-drenched beaches."]
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Alex O'Loughlin, Masi Oka, Grace Park, Daniel Dae Kim, Scott Caan, Lauren German", 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '6', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': '540985509', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '16 hours and 25 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 19, 2017', 'Actors': "Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan, Daniel Dae Kim, Grace Park, Masi Oka", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '6'}
Review Text: While I own & love the first season of Hawaii 5-0, I will not be purchasing Season Two. The fun and camaraderie of Season One was destroyed with slipshod writing and the introduction of the useless character of Lori Weston. Where I used to look forward to Monday nights to get my 5-0 fix, now I DVR the show and fast-forward through all the scenes that feature Lori. It's a shame, as I had initially planned to own all seasons as soon as they became available. Am sincerely hoping the writers do away with the Weston character in Season Three, and that the show regains its former greatness.
Review Title: Won't Be Buying Season Two
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

While I own & love the first season of Hawaii 5-0, I will not be purchasing Season Two. The fun and camaraderie of Season One was destroyed with slipshod writing and the introduction of the useless character of Lori Weston. Where I used to look forward to Monday nights to get my 5-0 fix, now I DVR the show and fast-forward through all the scenes that feature Lori. It's a shame, as I had initially planned to own all seasons as soon as they became available. Am sincerely hoping the writers do away with the Weston character in Season Three, and that the show regains its former greatness.

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference**: Enjoys action and crime television, particularly series that involve elite task forces.  
- **Content Engagement**: Initially enthusiastic about shows, particularly those with strong character dynamics and camaraderie; however, becomes critical when storylines or character introductions detract from overall enjoyment.  
- **Review Style**: Articulates disappointment clearly, providing specific reasons for dissatisfaction—emphasizes character impact on narrative quality.  
- **Commitment to Series**: Shows a willingness to invest in complete series but may withdraw future purchases if later seasons deviate from initial appeal.  
- **Expectations**: Values high-quality writing and character development; proactive in sharing hopes for improvements in future content.  
- **Viewing Habits**: Prefers to watch shows live but will utilize DVR to manage viewing experience, indicating a desire for control over how they consume content.  

Overall, the user exhibits discerning taste in television series, with a strong focus on character dynamics and writing quality, and is willing to reassess their commitment based on changes in the show's direction.
